sources.title: Hear live speech to speech translations with Live translate
sources.snippet: On your Android phone or tablet, open the Translate app . At the bottom, select the languages for your conversation. At the bottom, tap Live translate . The microphone automatically detects when one language stops and the other language starts. To hear a translation, tap any part of the text. To pause or resume translation, tap Speak .

citation_mappings.claim_text: Here are some free apps/tools you can use for live-time translation in conversations with French speakers — including options that work in real life or over calls: 1) Google Translate (iOS & Android) Has a Live Translate / Conversation mode that listens and translates back-and-forth in real time between languages like English and French. You speak, it detects and translates on the fly with on-screen text and optional audio responses. Google Help+1

Works for in-person or using the phone mic — not a full carrier voice call translator, but good for real-time dialogue. Fully free. 2) Microsoft Translator (iOS & Android) Offers a real-time conversation feature where two (or more) people can speak in their languages and get instant translated text (and in many cases audio) on their devices. Microsoft+1

sources.title: TalkPersona - Free real-time voice translator
sources.snippet: In addition to the AI video chatbot, TalkPersona also offers a free Instant Voice Translator for Real-Time Multilingual Conversations. It enables seamless real-time cross-language conversations. Always listens and instantly translates between your language and foreign languages, with optional audio playback. Perfect for travel, business, and cross-language communication.

citation_mappings.claim_text: It supports French and many languages, and is free to use. 3) TalkPersona Instant Voice Translator (Web / App) A free real-time voice translator that listens and translates spoken speech between languages (including French) live. TalkPersona

Works in browser or compatible app contexts — best for conversational back-and-forth, less so for standard phone calls. 4) Instant Voice Translate (Android) Free app for real-time voice translation between languages (including French ↔ English). Google Play

sources.title: Live Phone Call Translator App | EzDubs
sources.snippet: Top-tier Samsung Galaxy devices (e.g., S24, S23 series) offer a traditional, robotic live-translate mode for calls. However, these traditional android phone apps translate only after a sentence is spoken, and the voice is replaced by a robotic, third-party interpreter.

citation_mappings.claim_text: Not built into regular phone voice calls, but lets you speak into the app and hear translations live. Notes / Limitations Most free tools don’t integrate directly into regular phone carrier calls (the native phone dialer) without specialized services (which are usually paid). Google Translate and Microsoft Translator are the most straightforward for live conversation translation in real time without extra fees. For actual phone call translation where both sides hear translated speech during a normal phone call, dedicated services like EzDubs or Telelingo exist, but they may require paid plans. ezdubs.ai+1
